subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.0 release candidate 2 Test.None
msgSnippet: ... I m now actually partial to Robert Watkins idea that None should be public to allow explicitly expecting no exceptions.  (The package structure is likely
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:

> David Saff wrote:
> > Sadly, not as long as it's defined on an interface--and moving it
> > anywhere else would belie the fact that it's only meaningful to the
> Test
> > annotaton. We'll probably have to just javadoc it as "hands off".
> >
>
> But if it were non-public it wouldn't matter that it was only meaningful
> to the Test annotation, would it? You just use it there and nowhere else.

I'm now actually partial to Robert Watkins' idea that None should be
public to allow explicitly expecting no exceptions. (The package
structure is likely to remain that the API packages have only public
members in them--this has worked very well for large frameworks like
Eclipse.)

David Saff
